resource.chars:
to show that some if his conclusions were eroneous, yet I regard them as
fully justified at the time, by the information which the materials at
his command afforded; my own means of correcting them being only
supplied by the comparison I have been enabled to institute through
a much larger range of specimens. And it is with great satisfaction that I am enabled to add that, after careful
inspection of my preparations and drawings, Prof. Williamson
authorises me to express his full accordance in the results which
I shall now proceed to detail.
